
A careless admin generated two RSA keys using the same prime. Both public keys and 2678348895336653114416277989083658630557988560451396106173731818401553211867172016788597241737274779307591725002647773126312423351784524328363140843594138 were leaked—can you recover the secret?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=4363977066012815596447216198277476355252579521592961310810087376586219475652751310519722966162135431569401038698039802605289521702894810602440383150741201, e=613683559813894618448497709480600925258922575679759589019643165048089249132498127792921648466432827028676886496265300988759940057967802843448276781291741

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{4go9ulbq}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2678348895336653114416277989083658630557988560451396106173731818401553211867172016788597241737274779307591725002647773126312423351784524328363140843594138
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=4363977066012815596447216198277476355252579521592961310810087376586219475652751310519722966162135431569401038698039802605289521702894810602440383150741201, e=613683559813894618448497709480600925258922575679759589019643165048089249132498127792921648466432827028676886496265300988759940057967802843448276781291741
extra_info: p=66060404676423346872800475180839977674405718647431144332886904433687270840649, q=66060404676423346872800475180839977674405718647431144332886904433687270840649, φ(n)=4363977066012815596447216198277476355252579521592961310810087376586219475652619189710370119468389830619039358742690991167994659414229036793573008609059904
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
archetype: rsa
